itemDescription: MA; archdeacon of Bath and canon of Wells; cleric/religious official; British; 1809-1895

wikipedia_page.main:
Robert William Browne  (1809 in Southwark – 1895 in Wells) was the Archdeacon of Bath from 1860 to 1895.Bothamley was born in Southwark and educated at St John's College, Oxford. He was ordained deacon in 1832; and Priest in 1833. but stayed at St John's, firstly as Fellow and then Tutor  until 1839. In that year he began studying for a PhD at the  University of Heidelberg. In 1862 he became Rector of Weston-Super-Mare; and in 1863 a Canon of Wells Cathedral.
He died on 13 December 1895.
